name: Fernand Mondego
description: A rival of Edmond Dantès who covets his fiancée and betrays him to achieve his ambitions.

content.title: Background
content.body: Fernand Mondego is a character of Spanish origin in *"The Count of Monte Cristo"*. He is a cousin of Mercédès, with whom he is secretly in love. His early life is marked by envy of Edmond Dantès, who is both his rival in love and career.

content.title: Personality
content.body: Fernand is characterized by his envy, ambition, and ruthless pursuit of personal gain. Despite outward appearances of being a friend, he harbors deep resentment towards Edmond and is willing to betray him to achieve his desires.

content.title: Story Role
content.body: Fernand plays the role of the antagonist in *"The Count of Monte Cristo"*. He is one of the conspirators responsible for Edmond’s wrongful imprisonment, enabling him to marry Mercédès and rise in social status.

content.title: Relationships
content.body:
Key connections include:
* **Mercédès**: Fernand's cousin and object of unrequited love.
* **Edmond Dantès**: His rival, whom he betrays through orchestrating his wrongful imprisonment.
* **Albert de Morcerf**: His son with Mercédès.
